definition: to cleanse oneself/to sanctify oneself/self-cleaning (spark plug, oven etc)

sentences.english: Then he consecrated Jesse and his sons and invited them to the sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 撒母耳就使耶西和他衆子自潔，請他們來喫祭肉。

sentences.english: When a period of feasting had run its course, Job would send and have them purified.
sentences.chinese: 筵宴的日子過了，約伯打發人去叫他們自潔。
雙螺桿主機具有自潔功能。

sentences.english: After Moses had gone down the mountain to the people, he consecrated them, and they washed their clothes.
sentences.chinese: 摩西下山往百姓那裏去，叫他們自潔，他們就洗衣服。

definition: to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
mutually related karma (idiom); fates are intertwined/interdependent
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: wine, sex, avarice and temper (idiom); four cardinal vices
